entry.title: The Trial of Uther Pendragon
entry.summary:
Author: HerMajestyofLichtenstein

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 64,095Chapters: 41/?Kudos: 1,534

Summary: When Morgana invokes a long forgotten spell, the ancient and powerful Court of Magic is summoned to pass judgment on Uther Pendragon and his bloodline for their crimes against the magical world. But for the verdict to be carried out, every seat on the Council must be filled, and the chair of the Dragonlords has long stood empty. Now Merlin faces an impossible choice: side with his people and end Uther’s reign of terror, or save Arthur.

entry.title: The Once and Future Professor
entry.summary:
Author: Buffoonery

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 84,112Chapters: 21/?Kudos: 331

Summary: Professor Emeric Ambrose is Hogwarts' new Muggle Studies teacher. His qualifications include a deep, personal animosity towards every major author of the Arthurian legends, an unnerving ability to reason with sentient furniture, and the eyes of a man who has been tired for a very, very long time.He's also Merlin.All he wants is a quiet life. But with a king in a painting who won't stop giving bad advice, a magical portrait of his nemesis down the hall, and two red-headed apprentices who are determined to learn the art of "narrative chaos," Merlin is about to discover that the only thing worse than being forgotten by history is having it come back to haunt you. Literally.

entry.title: the burning saint
entry.summary:
Author: deathinsoftfocus

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,027Chapters: 2/37Kudos: 9

Summary: The Pendragons hunt monsters. It's what they've always done, what Arthur was born to do. So when his sister vanishes into the dark, consorting with fae and old gods, he's given one impossible task: find Emrys, the myth, the End-Bringer, the creature whispered about in hunter circles for fifty years.He doesn't expect Emrys to save his life.He doesn't expect to let him live.He definitely doesn't expect to fall in love with him.(A story about duty, monsters, and what it means to choose someone over everything you were raised to believe.)

entry.title: Green Eyed Monster
entry.summary:
Author: MerlinLikeTheBird

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,746Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 397

Summary: “Forget I said anything,” Merlin tried, failing to smother his snickering. He lowered his eyes to the ground, and bit down on his grin even as his shoulders shook with laughter. Neither of them was fooled. “Of course you’re not jealous. Why would you be? Just because Ser Erden is so very charming—” “He is not—” “And chivalrous—" “I bet he beats his servants,” Arthur insisted, with no proof or reason. “And his dogs.” “And handsome—” “Handsome?!” Arthur shouted, so loud that it boomed in Merlin’s ears. He jerked his head up in surprise. Dark spots of red had bloomed across Arthur’s cheeks, flush and furious. “He is not! He’s—shut up, Merlin!”

entry.title: The Prince & The Pauper
entry.summary:
Author: plotcole (Quint_Essentially)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 99,407Chapters: 18/26Kudos: 46

Summary: Extract from ‘Knights of the Temples: The Prince Arthur Story’ by T. H. Blanc, published 2021: 'There we have it. Violence, intrigue, danger, romance, and self-sacrifice. In a couple of short months, Captain Arthur Pendragon, eldest son of The Most Honourable The Marquess of Camelot, Lord Uther Pendragon, almost singlehandedly dismantled one of the most covert and sinister arms of the Axis Powers’ military forces, ensuring that its leader and the secret weapons she had designed would never again see the light of day. ' OR: The story of a young nobleman who couldn't stand by when his country needed him, and his loyal companion who would follow Arthur to the very ends of the Earth if he had to.
